tool.name: Chimera.check
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='chimera.check' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.chimeracheck\.chimeras?$:'$out_file --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --fasta="$fasta" --reference="$alignment.template" #if int($ksize.__str__) > 0: --ksize="$ksize" #end if #if int($increment.__str__) > 0: --increment="$increment" #end if #if $svg.gen == 'yes': --svg=true #if $svg.name.__str__ != "None" and len($svg.name.__str__) > 0: --name='$svg.name' #end if #if $svg.as_datasets.__str__ == "yes": --datasetid='$logfile.id' --new_file_path='$__new_file_path__' --new_datasets='^(\S+)\.chimeracheck\.svg$:svg' #end if #end if --processors=\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-8}

param.name: ksize
param.label: ksize - kmer length to determine differences between sequence fragments (uses default if < 1)

param.name: increment
param.label: increment - Increment for window slide on each iteration (uses default if < 1)
param.help: Default is 10, but you may set it up to sequence length minus twice the window.

param.name: gen
param.label: svg - Generate a SVG plot for each query sequence

param.name: name
param.label: name - Names of queries for which to generate SVG plot

param.name: as_datasets
param.label: Create a new history dataset for each image

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The chimera.check_ command identifies putative chimeras using the chimeraCheck approach. It looks at distance of left side of query to it's closest match + distance of right side of query to it's closest match - distance of whole query and its closest match over several windows.
Note: following the RDP model this method does not determine whether or not a sequence is chimeric, but allows you to determine that based on the IS values produced.
.. _chimera.check: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Chimera.check
